controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • controller.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.util.Observable
    The Controller handle all business logic and act as an interface between the GUI and the database.
    Version:
    90 Date: 11/27/13
    Author:
    Jacob Hall, Seth Kramer, Tyler Powers, Aaron Merril, David Swanson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_NUMBER_OF_REVIEWS
      The maximum number of reviews a paper can have in the system.
      static int MAX_NUMBER_USER_SUBMITTED_PAPERS
      The maximum number of papers a user in the system is allowed to submit to a conference.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()
        Constructor for the Controller. State initially set to LOGIN. Sets up the connection to the Derby Database on port 1527. If the Controller can't connect to the database, it prints to the console that it failed to connect.
        Preconditions: The Derby Network has been started.
        Postconditions: A Controller object is created.

    • Method Detail

      • setStateOfGUI

        public void setStateOfGUI(GUIEnum.StateOfGUI the_state)
        Set the next state the GUI should transition to. Note: setting this to a new state causes the Observable Object Controller to change states and notify Observers.
        Parameters:
        the_state - An enumeration of the GUI which will be set as the current state.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and a valid enum has been passed in.
        Postconditions: State is set to the passed in state.

      • getStateOfGUI

        public GUIEnum.StateOfGUI getStateOfGUI()
        Gets the next state the GUI should transition to.
        Returns:
        The updated current state.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: StateOfGUI enum returned.

      • checkValidUsername

        public java.lang.Boolean checkValidUsername(java.lang.String the_username)
        Checks the username in the database and returns true if it is the valid username of someone already in the system.
        Parameters:
        the_username - The username to be check in the database.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the username exists in the database.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Returns boolean whether the username exists in the Database.

      • checkValidUsernamePassword

        public java.lang.Boolean checkValidUsernamePassword(java.lang.String the_username,
                                           java.lang.String the_password)
        Checks the username and password combination against the database.
        Parameters:
        the_username - The username to check in the database.
        the_password - The corresponding password to check in the database.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the username/password combo are verified, false otherwise.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Returns boolean whether the username Password pair are in the Database.

      • addNewUser

        public void addNewUser(java.lang.String the_username,
              java.lang.String the_password,
              java.lang.String the_first_name,
              java.lang.String the_middle_name,
              java.lang.String the_last_name,
              java.lang.String the_specialty)
        Adds a new user to the database. GUI must first use checkValidUsername() to ensure no duplicates.
        Parameters:
        the_username - The login name for the user.
        the_password - The password that the username will use for login.
        the_first_name - The user's first name.
        the_middle_name - The user's middle initial.
        the_last_name - The user's last name.
        the_specialty - The user's engineering specialty (String from GUI).
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and checkValidUsername() has been called first and the name doesn't already exist in the system.
        Postconditions: The new user is added to the database.

      • setCurrentUsername

        public void setCurrentUsername(java.lang.String the_username)
        Sets the current user to the username of the person currently logged in.
        Parameters:
        the_username - The username of the current person logged in.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Current user is set to the passed in username.

      • getCurrentUsername

        public java.lang.String getCurrentUsername()
        Returns the username of the current person logged in.
        Returns:
        Returns the current user.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Returns a String of the current user.

      • getFullName

        public java.lang.String getFullName(java.lang.String the_username)
        Returns the full name of the individual when the username is passed in.
        Parameters:
        the_username - The username of the individual being queried.
        Returns:
        The full name of the person.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the passed in username exists in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns a String representation of the users full name.

      • checkConferenceExists

        public java.lang.Boolean checkConferenceExists(java.lang.String the_conference_title)
        Checks to see if the conference currently exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        the_conference_title - The title of the conference.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the conference title exists in database
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Returns a boolean of whether the conference exists.

      • createNewConference

        public void createNewConference(Conference the_conference)
        Creates a new conference. The GUI code must first checkConferenceExists() so duplicate conferences don't get entered into the database.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference object to be entered into the database.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and checkConferenceExists() has been called to ensure there are no duplicate conferences.
        Postconditions: Conference added to the Database.

      • setCurrentConference

        public void setCurrentConference(Conference the_conference_name)
        Sets the current conference to the conference of the person currently being looked at by the user.
        Parameters:
        the_conference_name - The conference to set as the current conference.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Sets the current conference to the Conference passed in.

      • getCurrentConference

        public Conference getCurrentConference()
        Returns the conference that is being looked at by the user.
        Returns:
        Returns the current conference.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Returns the current conference object.

      • createNewPaper

        public void createNewPaper(Conference the_conference,
                  java.lang.String the_username,
                  java.lang.String the_paper_title,
                  java.lang.String the_file_submitted,
                  GUIEnum.paperStatusAuthorViewable the_user_viewable_status,
                  GUIEnum.paperStatusAdminViewable the_admin_viewable_status)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method adds a new paper to database as long as MAX_NUMBER_USER_SUBMITTED_PAPERS hasn't been reached. If it has, this method throws an exception that needs to be caught by the calling function.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference that the paper is being added to.
        the_username - The username of the author.
        the_paper_title - The title of the paper.
        the_file_submitted - The path of the file being submitted.
        the_user_viewable_status - The paper status that's viewable for an author's purposes.
        the_admin_viewable_status - The paper status that's viewable for administrative purposes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws exception if MAX_NUMBER_USER_SUBMITTED_PAPERS reached.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the paper doesn't already exist in the Database.
        Postconditions: Either the paper is added to the Database, or an exception is thrown meaning the paper wasn't added due to too many papers being submitted to the passed in conference by the passed in user.

      • getRelationToPaper

        public GUIEnum.paperRelation getRelationToPaper(Conference the_conference,
                                       java.lang.String the_paper_title,
                                       java.lang.String the_username)
        Returns the relation of the person passed in with the paper passed in. Tells if they are Author, Reviewer, SUBPC, or PC. If they have multiple designations to a single paper this method returns the relation that is of highest priority: PC > SubPC > Reviewer > Author.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference that the paper belongs to.
        the_paper_title - The title of the paper to get relation for.
        the_username - The username of the person to get relation for.
        Returns:
        A paperRelation enum of the highest priority that the user has with the paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the conference, paper title, and username are all linked together in the Database.
        Postconditions: A paperRelation enum of the highest priority is returned.

      • setPaperStatus

        public void setPaperStatus(Conference the_conference,
                  java.lang.String the_paper_title,
                  GUIEnum.paperStatusAuthorViewable the_author_viewable_status,
                  GUIEnum.paperStatusAdminViewable the_admin_viewable_status)
        Sets the author and admin status of a paper.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper belongs to.
        the_paper_title - The title of the paper.
        the_author_viewable_status - The author status to be updated to.
        the_admin_viewable_status - The admin status to be updated to.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the conference and paper title are linked together in the database.
        Postconditions: The status of the paper is updated to the passed in values.

      • getAdminPaperStatus

        public GUIEnum.paperStatusAdminViewable getAdminPaperStatus(Conference the_conference,
                                                   java.lang.String the_paper_title)
        Gets the admin status of a paper in a given conference. Returns paperStatusAdminViewable.isNULL if the paper doesn't exist in the passed in conference.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper belongs to.
        the_paper_title - The title of the paper to get the admin status for.
        Returns:
        Returns a paperStatusAdminViewable enum indicating the admin status.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the conference and paper title are linked together in the Database.
        Postconditions: paperStatusAdminViewable enum returned. If the conference and paper title aren't linked, returns paperStatusAdminViewable.isNULL.

      • getStatusAuthorView

        public GUIEnum.paperStatusAuthorViewable getStatusAuthorView(Conference the_conference,
                                                    java.lang.String the_paper_title)
        Gets the author status of a paper in a given conference. Returns paperStatusAuthorViewable.isNULL if the paper doesn't exist in the passed in conference.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper belongs to.
        the_paper_title - The title of the paper to get the author status for.
        Returns:
        Returns a paperStatusAuthorViewable enum indicating the author status.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the conference and paper title are linked together in the Database.
        Postconditions: paperStatusAuthorViewable enum returned. If the conference and paper title aren't linked, returns paperStatusAuthorViewable.isNULL.

        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: Returns a String representation of the current paper.

      • getPaperFilePath

        public java.lang.String getPaperFilePath(Conference the_conf,
                                java.lang.String the_paper_title)
        Returns the text of the paper that is passed in.
        Parameters:
        the_conf - The conference the paper being examined belongs to.
        the_paper_title - The title of the paper that is getting its text returned.
        Returns:
        Returns the text of the paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the conference and paper title are related in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns a String of the file path to the paper.

      • deletePaper

        public void deletePaper(Conference the_conference,
               java.lang.String the_username,
               java.lang.String the_paper_title)
        Deletes the paper from the table.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference object.
        the_username - The username of the current user.
        the_paper_title - The title of the paper to be deleted.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and a paper related by conference, username, and paper title exists in the Database.
        Postconditions: Paper in Database linked by all three passed in parameters is removed from the Database.

      • createNewReview

        public void createNewReview(java.lang.String the_reviewer_username,
                   Conference the_conf,
                   java.lang.String the_paper,
                   java.lang.String the_paper_author,
                   java.lang.String the_comments_to_subpc,
                   int[] the_answersRadioBtn,
                   java.lang.String the_summary_comments)
        Creates a new review in the database.
        Parameters:
        the_reviewer_username - The username of the reviewer.
        the_conf - The conference the review is associated with.
        the_paper - The name of the paper the review is for.
        the_paper_author - The author of the paper being reviewed.
        the_comments_to_subpc - The comments to the sub program chair.
        the_answersRadioBtn - The answers to the review questions.
        the_summary_comments - The comments on the paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created.
        Postconditions: If a Review linked by conference, username, and paper title exists- the Review is updated with the passed in values. If not, a new Review is added to the Database.

      • canAddReview

        public boolean canAddReview(Conference the_conf,
                   java.lang.String the_paper,
                   java.lang.String the_username)
        A method that is called to see if the number of reviews on a paper is less than MAX_NUMBER_OF_REVIEWS and that the current user hasn't already submitted a review for the passed in paper.
        Parameters:
        the_conf - the conference that the paper is in
        the_paper - the name of the paper
        the_username - the user that is trying to submit the paper.
        Returns:
        true if the current user has not submitted a review and the number of reviews is less than or equal to MAX_NUMBER_OF_REVIEWS.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the passed in Conference and paper are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Boolean returned of whether another Review from that user can be added to the Database.

      • getPaperAuthor

        public java.lang.String getPaperAuthor(Conference the_conf,
                              java.lang.String the_paper)
        Used by an administrative user to see the author of the paper that they are examining. Returns a blank string if nothing was found.
        Parameters:
        the_conf - The conference that the paper is a part of.
        the_paper - The name of the paper the current user is looking at (not the author of the paper).
        Returns:
        Returns the username of the author of the paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns a String of the author's username.

      • addPaperRecommendation

        public void addPaperRecommendation(java.lang.String the_sub_pc_username,
                          Conference current_conf,
                          java.lang.String current_paper_being_recommended,
                          java.lang.String the_paper_author,
                          int the_numerical_value,
                          java.lang.String the_rational_for_recommendation)
        Adds a recommendation of the SubProgramChair to the database with their grade and rationale of the paper passed in.
        Parameters:
        the_sub_pc_username - The subprogramchair username recommending the paper.
        current_conf - The conference the paper being recommended belongs to.
        current_paper_being_recommended - The paper that is being recommended.
        the_paper_author - The author of the paper being recommended.
        the_numerical_value - The grade the subprogramchair gave the paper.
        the_rational_for_recommendation - The rationale behind the subprogramchair's grade.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and all passed in parameters are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: If the recommendation exists, the recommendation in the Database is updated, otherwise it is added to the Database.

      • getPaperRecommendationRationale

        public java.lang.String getPaperRecommendationRationale(Conference the_conf,
                                               java.lang.String the_paper)
        Retrieves the SubPC's recommendation for a paper from the database given a conference and a paper within that conference. If the paper does not exist in that conference the sentinel value paperID = -1 and it returns a blank string for the rationale.
        Parameters:
        the_conf - The conference the recommendation belongs to.
        the_paper - The paper the recommendation belongs to.
        Returns:
        Returns the recommendation of the paper being examined.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns a String representation of the rationale from the Database.

      • getPaperRecommendationNumericalValuefinal

        public int getPaperRecommendationNumericalValuefinal(Conference the_conf,
                                            java.lang.String the_paper)
        Retrieves the numerical grade given to the_paper passed by the subprogramchair of that paper relating to the_conf passed in.
        Parameters:
        the_conf - The conference the paper is in whose grade is being retrieved.
        the_paper - The paper whose grade is being retrieved.
        Returns:
        Returns the numerical grade of the paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns an int reprenting the recommendation's value from the Database.

      • getPaperRecommendationSubPCName

        public java.lang.String getPaperRecommendationSubPCName(Conference the_conf,
                                               java.lang.String the_paper)
        Retrieves the SubProgramChair's username from the recommendation of the paper passed in from the conference passed in.
        Parameters:
        the_conf - The conference the paper whose recommendation is being retrieved.
        the_paper - The paper whose recommendation is being retrieved.
        Returns:
        Returns the SubProgramChair's username.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns a String representation of the SubPC's name from the Database.

      • getUsersAssignedAsReviewers

        public java.lang.String[] getUsersAssignedAsReviewers(Conference the_conference,
                                             java.lang.String current_paper)
        This method returns all of the userNames of the reviewers that are assigned to a particular paper. The length of the array indicates how many are assigned (i.e. 0 = no reviewers). This method also prints to the console if the paper passed in has no association to the conference passed in.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper belongs to.
        current_paper - The paper whose reviewers are being retrieved.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of reviewers of the passed in paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns an array of all the username's of people reviewing the paper. The length of this array is a direct representation of how many reviewers there are for it.

      • getUserAssignedAsPC

        public java.lang.String getUserAssignedAsPC(Conference the_conference)
        Method that returns the PC for a given conference. This method returns null if the conference can't be found in the database.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference to get PC of.
        Returns:
        Returns the username of the PC given the passed in conference.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference exists in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns a String representation of the PC's username.

      • getUserAssignedAsSubPC

        public java.lang.String getUserAssignedAsSubPC(Conference the_conference,
                                      int current_paper)
        Retrieves the username of the subprogram chair given a passed in Conference and paper.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference being examined.
        current_paper - The paper being examined.
        Returns:
        Returns the subprogram chair's username.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper ID are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns a String representation of the SubPC's username from the Database.

      • getAvailableReviewers

        public java.lang.String[] getAvailableReviewers(Conference the_conference,
                                       java.lang.String the_paper,
                                       java.lang.String the_person_assigning)
        Method that returns all of the available reviewers for a given paper. This method follows the business rules: - the reviewer can't be the author of the paper. - the reviewer can't be the person assigning the review, unless they're the PC. - the reviewer in this list can't be one of the reviewers already assigned to this paper (they can't be assigned twice).
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper being looked at belongs to.
        the_paper - The paper being checked for available reviewers.
        the_person_assigning - The subpc/pc assigning the reviewers to the paper.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of available users who can review this paper following the above business rules.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns an array of all the usernames that are available to review the passed in paper in the passed in Conference.

      • addReviewers

        public void addReviewers(Conference the_conference,
                java.lang.String the_paper,
                java.lang.String[] the_reviewers)
        Adds the reviewers to the passed in paper.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper is in.
        the_paper - The paper the reviewers are reviewing.
        the_reviewers - The users who are reviewing the paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Adds the Reviewers to the database and submits a "blank" review for each one that can be updated in the future.

      • getAvailableForSubPC

        public java.lang.String[] getAvailableForSubPC(Conference current_conf,
                                      int current_paper,
                                      java.lang.String the_pc)
        A method that populates a string array of all users that are capable of being a subprogram chair. Note: - the PC can't be the SubPC. - the Author of the paper can't be the SubPC of their own paper. - the reviewer can't be the SubPC, although we shouldn't have to check this. The SubPC is the person who assigns the reviewer, so it's the chicken and egg thing. - any other business rules I'm forgetting? (Jacob)
        Parameters:
        current_conf - the conference the paper is in
        current_paper - the paper that is having a subprogram chair added.
        the_pc - the name of the program chair.
        Returns:
        a string array that contains all usernames of users that are available for subprogram chair.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper ID are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns an array of usernames that are eligible to be the SubPC.

      • addSubPC

        public void addSubPC(Conference the_conference,
            java.lang.String the_paper,
            java.lang.String the_sub_pc)
        Adds a user as a SubPC to a given conference and paper.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper belongs to.
        the_paper - The paper being assigned to the SubPC.
        the_sub_pc - The username of the SubPC.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Adds the SubPC to the Database linked to both the passed in Conference and paper.

      • getReviews

        public Review[] getReviews(Conference the_conference,
                  java.lang.String the_paper)
        Returns an array of Review Objects of the given paper in the given conference.
        Parameters:
        the_conference - The conference the paper belongs to.
        the_paper - The paper whose reviews are being retrieved.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of Review objects of the given paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns an array of Reviews from the Database.

      • getMyConferences

        public Conference[] getMyConferences(java.lang.String the_username)
        Returns an array of Conference objects that the user that is passed in belongs to.
        Parameters:
        the_username - The username of the logged in person.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of conferences that the user is associated with.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and username exists in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns an array of Conferences that the user has some association with.

      • getUpcommingConferences

        public Conference[] getUpcommingConferences(java.lang.String the_username)
        Gets all conferences that are upcoming but not in myConferences.
        Parameters:
        the_username - The username of the current user.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of Conferences that contains all upcoming conferences.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and username exists in the Database.
        Postconditions: An array of Conferences is returned containing all future Conferences that they have no association with.

      • getMyPapers

        public Paper[] getMyPapers(Conference the_conf,
                  java.lang.String the_username)
        Returns an array of Papers that are in the conference passed in and are associated with the user.
        Parameters:
        the_conf - The conference whose papers are being examined.
        the_username - The username of the person who is associated with the returned papers.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of Papers associated with the user.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and the Conference and paper title are linked in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns an array of papers that the user has some association to.

      • getPaperID

        Gets the paperID associated with the name of the paper. TODO: Need more than this to get paperID effectively.
        Parameters:
        current_paper - The name of the paper.
        Returns:
        Returns the ID# of the paper.
        Preconditions: A Controller object has been created and paper exists in the Database.
        Postconditions: Returns the ID of the paper.
